msContents.summary: This manuscript contains the whole text of a commentary on Amalaṉ Āti Pirāṉ by Periyavāccāṉ Piḷḷai and a fragment of Aḻakiya Perumāḷ Nāyaṉār's commentary on the same root text.

msItem.title: Amalaṉātipirāṉ vyākhyānaṃ
msItem.author: Periyavāccāṉ Piḷḷai
msItem.incipit: praṇavaṃ pōle atisaṃkucitamāyiruttal vedamum vedopabṛhmaṇamāṉa maṉā bhāratamum pōle parantu tuṟuppukkīṭāyiruttal
msItem.explicit:
muktaprāpyam-āṉa puruṣārtthattai ya
nubhavittār eṉkaiyālē, ellām avaṉ collāy viṭṭatu. yippāṭṭālē kṛṣṇaṉuṭaiya paṭiyum iṅkē uṇṭ’ eṉkiṟār
msItem.colophon:
tiruppāṇiyāḻvār tiruvaṭikaḷē caṟaṇam | ṉayiṉār tiruvaṭikaḷē caṟaṇam | jīyar tiruvaṭikaḷē caṟaṇam | appaṉ tiruvaṭikaḷē caṟaṇam |
duṃdubhi varṣaṃ paṅkuṉi uttaraṃ paurṇamiyileḻutiṉatu tirunārāyaṇapurattile.
in the middle of the foliośrīmadvadhūlakulavāridhipūrṇacaṃdraṃ(?)śrīmadvarapradagurūttamaputraratnaṃ
śrīśailadeśika kṛpātta samastavidyaṃ śrīraṃgadeśikam ahaṃ śaraṇaṃ prapadye There is an Ācārya lineage by the name of Kōyil Kantāṭai vādhūla Appaṉ Svāmi Tirumāḷīkai at Śrī Persumpūtūr. Those Svāmis are usually called Appaṉ Svāmi. May be them.
